physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At initial psychiatric assessment, patient was noted to be staring blankly, with monosyllabic speech and blunted affect. Neurological examination showed decreased upward gaze, positive glabella tap, decreased deep tendon reflexes in lower extremities, resting tremor, decreased sensation to pinprick in a glove-and-stocking pattern, and ataxia on tandem gait.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, patient exhibited agitation and noncommunicative behavior after release from prison. After treatment, condition improved significantly, with reports of complete absence of auditory hallucinations and paranoia 8 months later. Mild tardive dyskinesia was observed after long-term treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: During subsequent assessments, patient demonstrated a rumpled appearance, blank stare, decreased movements, and paucity of thought content upon readmission. Denied feeling depressed, and affect was blunted.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Psychotic symptoms initially improved during treatment with haloperidol. Symptoms stabilized after 6 weeks of treatment and residual symptoms were noted over time, such as mild paranoia, insomnia, akathisia, and tardive dyskinesia.
